2025/07/10

[Critical Update]
The configuration procedure for "PUCCH - Group Hopping" was
previously missing, so sections 2.2.4.1, 2.4.3.1, and 2.5.3.4, which
describe initial settings under various conditions, have been
updated.
In versions prior to MX800010A v11.00.33.00, the default value was
set to 'Neither', which differs from the Common Test Environment

11.00.33.00

defined in 3GPP TS 38.508-1 Chapter 4 and is not suitable for
conformance testing under PUCCH conditions. From MX800010A
v11.00.33.00 onward, the  "PUCCH - Group Hopping" default value
has been updated to  'Enable' in accordance with the 3GPP
specification. If testing is conducted with earlier versions, please
review and adjust the configuration accordingly.

2.2. NSA (EN-DC) call connection for MT8821C LTE anchor
This section describes the procedure for NSA call connection.
On NSA call connection, a MT8821C unit is used as LTE anchor. The connection diagram of NSA connection
with MT8821C is described in section 2.2.1.
And, it is necessary to set Primary-Secondary operating mode to NSA on MT8821C unit.

System Configuration - Common - Primary-Secondary operating mode

If any MT8821C devices other than those using the Raw Socket protocol are registered as network devices in
NI-MAX, the MT8000A may be able to access the MT8821C you intend to control remotely.
As a result, the MT8821C may not be available for building an EN-DC environment.
In this case, turn off the remote control of the MT8821C and set the RAN Operation to EN-DC.
To avoid the issue, follow one of the methods below.
- When the MT8821C needs to be registered as a network device in NI-MAX, change the MT8821C device’s

protocol setting to Raw Socket.
- When the MT8821C does not need to be registered as a network device in NI-MAX, remove the MT8821C
registration from the NI-MAX settings on the Control PC.

2.2.8. LTE-NR Frame Timing Synchronization for contiguous EN-DC measurement [TDD]

When both LTE and NR Frame structure are TDD, to measure the contiguous EN-DC / non-contiguous EN-DC
appropriately, adjust the UL / DL timing between the MT8821C LTE and the NR (Refer toFig. 2.2.8-1). The following
process is an example for LTE TDD configuration 2.
Every NR UL slot needs to be synchronized with an LTE UL slot. On the other hand, every LTE UL slot does not need to
be synchronized with an NR UL slot.

2.3. NSA (EN-DC) call connection for  NSA Single Box
There are three models of NSA Single Box as follows:

?  High end model
NSA Single Box -  High end model has two baseband modules and two RF modules,
Enhanced RF Module (MT8000A-033).
Baseband module (Slot3) and RF module (Slot2) are used as LTE anchor.

?  Middle range model
NSA Single Box - Middle range model has two baseband modules , and two RF modules,
RF Base module(MT8000A-020/021 x 2) or Multi RF Modules (MT8000A-031/032).
Baseband module (Slot3) and RF module (Slot2) are used as LTE anchor.

Entry model

NSA Single Box -  Entry model has one baseband module and one RF module(MT8000A-020/021 x 1), or
one baseband module and two RF modules(MT8000A-020/021 x 2). The latter configuration has two
RF modules, but since the Entry model only supports Slotl  RF module, Slot2 RF module cannot be used.
TRx1 on Slotl  is used only as NR RF port, and TRx2 on Slotl  is used only as LTE RF port.
Only 1CC SISO is supported for both LTE and NR.

2.3.10. How to do the test in Stand Alone
Stand Alone(SA) call connection is supported.
Please refer to 2.4 except for the following restrictions.

Middle range / High end model

?  When RAN operation is SA(5G Standalone), Slotl  of MT8000A RF module is used only as NR. Slot2 RF

cannot be used as NR RF.

?  Supported NR features are same as if there was only one baseband module.

Entry model

?  When RAN operation is SA(5G Standalone), Slotl  TRx1 of MT8000A RF module is used only as NR.

Slotl  TRx2 RF cannot be used as NR RF.
In addition to the restriction for Middle range model, carrier aggregation and MIMO are not supported.

?

All models

?  EN-DC(E-UTRA- NR Dual Connectivity, Single Box) and SA(5G SandAlone) can be set for RAN

Operation. The remote command to switch "RAN operation" is the same as the command that is used
when FW type is "Default".
IP data transfer test is not supported.

?
?  FR2 is not supported.

When testing the features of Stand Alone(SA) without the above restrictions , please switch the system to
MX800010A with Type “Default” according to the procedure in this chapter.

Install a MX800010A version where Type is selected as “Default” if not yet installed. Please note that NSA
Single Box is installed using MX800010A version where Type is selected as “NSASB”. Also please take note
that “Default” and “NSASB” needs to be installed on separate System Number.
For installation instructions, please refer to the MX800010A NR TDD Measurement Software Operation Manual.

2.6.6. FR1 + FR2 NRDC test (2Box)
The procedure of FR1 + FR2 for 2Box is introduced.
It it able to test a configuration of up to FR1 8CA + FR2 8CA by assigning FR2 carrier to Box2 and FR1 carrier to Box1.

By setting Primary Box to enhanced RF module, FR1 can be used up to DL4CA.

MT8000A-033 Tx ports” for details.

The test configuration that can be achieved with the MT8000A NSA single box with MT8000A-033 enhanced RF module
(eRF) is shown below.

2.9.1. Features of eRF
Basically, please refer to 2.8.1.
This section mainly describes about LTE.

2.9.1.1. Tx-A and Tx-B
HW specifications of both Tx-A and Tx-B are same as 2.8.1.1.

2.9.3.4. Loss settings
Same setting Procedure as in 2.8.3.4 except for the following.

Regarding the explanation of 2.8.3.4 [External Loss = On], SLOT1 External Loss setting commands are for NR side
and SLOT2 External Loss setting commands are for LTE side in the case of NSA single box. Please switch Remote
Command Destination(NR or LTE) with REM_DEST command before executing these External Loss setting
commands(EXTLOSSW_IND / ULEXTLOSSJND / DLEXTLOSSJND) for each SLOTs.

Regarding the External Loss Table setting explanation of 2.8.3.4 [External Loss = Common], the NR frequency
setting example of the 2.9.3.3 is different from the setting example of 2.8.3.4. In the case of NSA single box, please
change NR frequency and add the loss setting of LTE test frequency to External Loss Table. And the LOSSTBLVAL
command needs to be executed to NR side. Please switch Remote Command Destination to NR(REM_DEST NR)
before executing LOSSTBLVAL command.

Regarding the External Loss Table ID setting explanation of 2.8.3.4 [External Loss = Common], SLOT1 External Loss
Table ID setting command is for NR side and SLOT2 External Loss Table ID setting command is for LTE side in the
case of NSA single box. Please switch Remote Command Destination(NR or LTE) with REM_DEST command before
executing these External Loss setting commands(EXTLOSSW_IND / EXTLOSSTBLIDERFJND) for each SLOTs.

sections of each test condition.

(8)  A Log directory is created in the same directory as lnstallerSetupWizard.exe, and log files of lnstallerSetupWizard.exe

(log_{timestamp}.txt) and Setup.exe are output inside.

The Log Text
The log file of lnstallerSetupWizard.exe contains the following:
Software name, Installation target, System number, Firmware type, Result of installation
Examples:

MX800000A,App,FW,0, ,1
MX800010A,App,FW,10,NSASB,-1

If the installation target is Application only, nothing will be output for the system number and FW type.
MX800000A doesn't have FW type, so FW type for MX800000A always shows nothing.
The installation result shows 1 for success, -1 for failure, and 0 if the installation was not performed.
Logs are output only for software that was the target of installation (if at least one of the Application and Firmware
checkboxes was checked).

2.10.2.3. Installation assistance from external tools
It is also possible to pass startup arguments to this tool for execution.
In that case, this tool installs MX800000A/MX800010A according to the argument and automatically exits.
At that time, the screen will not be displayed.

Arguments
The following arguments can be passed to this tool.

Argument
quiet

/sys x

/type {NSASB}

Meaning
Enter “quiet” as the first argument when performing a silent installation.
If omitted, silent installation will not be executed, and the GUI will be launched.
Specify the system number where the MX800010A Firmware is installed. If
omitted, it will be installed in #01.
Specify NSASB as the MX800010A Firmware type. If omitted, Default will be
selected.

2.10.2.5. What to do when an error occurs
If an error message is displayed while using this tool, please refer to the following.

"There are no install packages in the directory this tool exits in."
This message is displayed when there is no install package for MX800000A/MX800010A in the same directory as
installerSetupWizard.exe. Confirm that the Install Package to be installed is placed in the same directory as
installerSetupWizard.exe and click the Execute Install button again.

"There is no Setup.exe in the install package. Please check if the install package is correct."
This message is displayed when Setup.exe does not exist in the install package for MX800000A/MX800010A. Check the
contents of the target install package, confirm that Setup.exe is included, and press the Execute Install button again. If the
install package does not include Setup.exe, please contact our support team.

"The directory was too long. Extracting the install package failed."
This message is displayed when the installer fails to extract because the destination path of MT8000A RF Measurement
Software Installer is too long. Move the expansion destination of it to a directory with a shorter absolute path and execute
InstallerSetupWizard.exe again.

"The installation failed. Please check the log in our install package and inquire to our support team."
This message is displayed when Setup.exe fails to install. Please contact support with the log text in the Log folder.

"MX800010A installation was canceled because MX800000A installation failed."
This message is displayed when MX800000Aand MX800010Aare installed sequentially, and the installation of
MX800000A fails. If the installation of MX800000A fails, the installation of MX800010A will be canceled. Check the
MX800000A installation error message and run the installation again

Uplink power

3.9. RX Measurements for CA

The following test procedures can be used for MT8000A.

3.9.1.  ARIB.cforCA (TS38.521-1 7.3A.0.3)

This test item is reference sensitivity relaxation test for Inter-band CA.
For the UE which supports inter-band carrier aggregation, the requirement for  reference sensitivity is relaxed by
ARIB,c.
ARIB,c is defined in TS38.521-1 Table 7.3A.0.3.2.1-1. Unless otherwise specified, this value is set to 0.
Please refer to 3.7.3.2 for the test procedure.

3.9.2. Reference sensitivity exceptions due to UL harmonic interference for CA (TS38.521-1

7.3A.0.4)

This test item is reference sensitivity relaxation test for Inter-band CA.
When a band is affected by UL harmonic interference from another band in the same CA configuration, the
requirement for reference sensitivity is relaxed and UL configuration exception is applied.
Reference sensitivity exception is defined in TS38.521-1 Table 7.3A.0.4-1 and Table 7.3A.0.4-4.
UL configuration exception is defined in TS38.521-1 Table 7.3A.0.4-2 and Table 7.3A.0.4-4a.
Please refer to 3.7.3.2 for the test procedure.
